page.title: 06RURAL CARLISLE
page.content: Etterby has very few houses and a lot of fields.The railway<now disused> passes through it and was one reason why houses were built.The Caledonian Buildings were built for the railway workers.There is now a council estate, consisting of terraced houses and semi detached.The shops are a sweetshop,the Co-op ,a newsagent,a Post Office and a fish and chip shop. Three roads lead into the country. Etterby Road has mainly terraced houses,including Caledonian Buildings. Stainton Road has semis,old and new, and a plant nursery.It leads to en- closed rough grazing land and a big dairy farm.On the left of Kingmoor Road is Kingmoor Nature Trail.On the right is an old factory and a garage.
